item.title: Why we do that
item.description: The Witcher 3 is an excellent RPG game; the studio revealed The Witcher 3’s sales numbers topped 28 million by the end of 2019. The Witcher 3 was recognized as game of the year by IGN, GameSpot, Game Informer and other gaming publications. The game received a Golden Joystick Award for Best Storytelling, Best Visual Design, and Best Gaming Moment, and The Game Awards for Best Role-Playing Game and Studio of the Year for CD Projekt Red.

item.title: Dataset
item.description: The game is famous and has catalyzed many communities. However, to limit the scope of the project, the data that will be used is from two sources. The original data comes from [Wikipedia][https://witcher.fandom.com/wiki/Witcher_Wiki], which is the main source of this project. We extract 730 characters and 121 monsters from “The Witcher 3” and its DLCs (Downloadable content, is additional content created for an already released video game). Another dataset is from [Transcripts Fandom][https://transcripts.

item.title: Network
item.description: The network consists with 787 nodes and 1514 edges which contains all the creatures included both characters and bestiaries. Each character has different attributes, such as race, profession, nationality, etc. Monsters have eleven categories, such as Elementa, Hybrids, and their respective locations. Some characters are also belongs to bestiaries, that’s why the nodes is 787 rather than 730 + 121 = 851. These graph shows a little more variety, but most of the nodes from this subset of nodes with a degree higher than 5 have a degree lower than around 50.

item.title: Distribution of bestiary
item.description: Where are the bestiaries? In the world of The Witcher 3, the conflict between humans and monsters occupies most of the chapter. In the game, the player often encounters the choice of whether to favor non-human creatures or humans. Which side to choose to help? Kind monsters or malicious human beings. The choices made by the players have different consequences. we can see radanian has most types of bestiary, you can check the information of Radanian.

item.title: Sentiment Analysis of Dialog
item.description: Which characters use the most words in total? Geralt and Yennefer should be the main characters, but their sentence is short corresponding to their characteristic: very decisive and executive. While Jaskie, the green bar, he is a poet, minstrel, bard, and Geralt’s best friend. Obviously his constant chatter did live up to his career, which is why he was hated by Geralt in the first place. The blue one is Stregobor, a magic, who likes to say something unfathomable, like riddles, which is complicated and annoying.

item.title: Wordcloud
item.description: The four main races in The Witcher 3 The stories, connections, and conflicts between Geralt and characters from other races. It is also why the Witcher 3 game is rich in content and more immersive.We use word clouds to analyze high-frequency words of different races, their characteristics and their connections with Geralt. We can see in the word cloud of human ,the words: human and humans have the highest frequency.

item.title: conclusion
item.description: From the above analysis, we can find that the background story and settings of The Witcher 3 are related to the performance of the characters in the game and the distribution of monsters. This also proves that building a game world in which the lines and stories are not inconsistent can greatly improve the player’s sense of immersion.
